amendment.description: Amendment modifies the formula for allocating funds for sewage treatment plant construction. It retains the bill's method of allocating funds based on a State's population size and sewage treatment needs, but eliminates provisions which place a 10% cap on the amount of change each State's allocation may increase or decrease, relative to existing funding levels.
amendment.purpose: An amendment (printed as amendment No. 27 in the Congressional Record of May 9) to modify the formula for allocating federal funds for sewage treatment plant construction. The amendment would retain the bill's method of allocating funds based on a state's population size and sewage treatment needs, but the amendment would eliminate the provisions in the bill which place a 10% cap on the amount of change each state's allocation may increase or decrease, relative to existing funding levels.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Lipinski amendment (A023) Agreed to by recorded vote: 247 - 154 (Roll no. 328).
